member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.AutoRefresh
member.summary: Updates a group of Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms controls on a timed interval.

remarks.para:
Use the server control to update a control or a group of controls at a specified interval. The property specifies the amount of time between each update, and the event is raised when the timer elapses. Use to specify which controls are updated and to make periodic updates to a group of controls from one location.
specifies whether the timer is active and whether the event will be raised.
contains the collection of controls that are updated by default when the event is raised. The and properties can be modified from within the callback.

filter.name: VS2008|VS2010
filter.note: For more information about the AutoRefresh control, refer to Measurement Studio AutoRefresh vs. ASP.NET AJAX UpdatePanel and Timer.

member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms .NET Controls

member.summary: Provides the base class for several Measurement Studio Web Forms controls.
member.remarks:
provides properties to configure the appearance of Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms controls. You can use , , , and to customize the background and foreground of the control. Use to change the type of border around the control. You can change the caption and the caption background color, font, foreground color, and position with , , , , and , respectively.
For more information about the Web Forms controls, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms .NET Controls.
member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms .NET Controls

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.DynamicWebImage
member.summary: Displays an image in a Web page that is dynamically created and rendered on a Web server.

remarks.para: is similar to the ASP.NET control, except that the images are dynamically created and rendered at page request time. is the base class for all Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms controls that render as images in a Web page.

Use to configure the type of the image. Possible types include Windows bitmap, GIF, JPEG, or PNG. Use to specify the text that is displayed when the image is not available. You can specify the alignment of the image relative to adjacent content with . You can configure the state and expiration of the dynamically created images with , , and .
remarks.note: For more information about , refer to Web Browser Compatibility with Measurement Studio Web Forms Controls.

member.seealso: Web Browser Compatibility with Measurement Studio Web Forms Controls

member.summary: Draws the control with the specified .
member.param: A that contains the drawing data.

remarks.para: The in specifies the to use for drawing. The in specifies the bounds in which the control is drawn.

Use to draw the control to a GDI+ drawing surface by passing the appropriate object. The object can represent the drawing surface of an image, the drawing surface of another device such as the printer, or the drawing surface of an area of the screen other than the area in which the component is located. Passing the drawing surface of an image allows the component to be drawn to an image format of your choice. You can query the bounds and size of the control using and .

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.ControlBase.BeforeDrawCaption
member.summary: Occurs before the caption is drawn.
member.remarks: You can use to participate in the drawing of the . The event occurs before the control begins to draw the caption, but after the has already drawn. Set the property of the event argument to to cancel drawing of the caption. Cancelling the drawing of the caption prevents the caption from being drawn. members.member:
Represents the class for the Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms graph that accepts data values.
You can use the collection to include multiple instances on a single graph. With multiple plots, you can plot multiple sets of data in the same plot area. You can determine whether plot colors are assigned by a color generator with the property, and you can change the plot color assignment with the property.
Use to plot the imaginary part against the real part of the or an array of imaginary values against an array of real values. plots imaginary values against real values by appending the values to the existing data.
To plot , you must use . For more information about the complex graph control, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls or Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Complex Graph .NET Control Features.
Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Complex Graph .NET Control Features . 6/11/2009 6:01:53 PM Measurement Studio True

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.Graph
member.summary: Provides an base class for all Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms graph controls.
member.remarks:
is the base class for all graph controls. Use a graph control to visualize data in a plot area.
supports multiple plots on a single graph. Use multiple plots to plot multiple sets of data in the same plot area. occurs when the collection of plots is modified through an add, remove, insert, or clear operation.
You can use to clear data from all of the plots in the graph plot collection.
, , and provide the ability to change the appearance of the plot area. To retrieve the bounds of the plot area, use . Custom drawing of the plot area is supported through the and events. occurs before the plot area is drawn. occurs after the plot area is drawn. , and provide a convenient way to draw the plot area image, grid lines, and plot area components, such as plots and cursors, while custom drawing the plot area. Use these events to participate in the drawing of the plot area.
Use and to zoom into the plot area around a point or a selection. The event is raised when zooming interactively or programmatically. pans the plot area relative to the existing view. can undo the last zoom or pan operation. The event is raised when the zoom or pan is undone interactively or programmatically. reverts all zoom and pan operations to restore the plot area to its initial state. The event is raised when the plot area is reset interactively or programmatically.
The client coordinates of the plot area differ from the actual coordinates to enhance ease of use. You must use the bounds of the plot area in virtual coordinates when passing arguments to , , and . The virtual coordinates of the plot area are defined from (0.0, 0.0) to (1.0, 1.0). and convert client coordinates to virtual coordinates. and convert virtual coordinates to client coordinates.
For more information about the graph controls, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls.
member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.Graph.ZoomAroundPoint(System.Single)
member.summary: Zooms around the center of the plot area using the specified zoom factor.
member.param: The factor used to perform the zoom.

exception.para: The is less than or equal to 0.0.

member.remarks:
A value less than 1.0 indicates a zoom out, and a value greater than 1.0 indicates a zoom in. For example, a value of 0.8 zooms out by 80%, and a value of 1.5 zooms in by 150%. If is set to 1.0, the plot area is not zoomed because a value of 1.0 zooms by 100% of the current view.
Calling raises the event with set to .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.Graph.PanXY(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Pans the plot area according to the specified horizontal and vertical factors.
member.param: The horizontal factor.
The vertical factor.
member.remarks:
If you set to 0.0, the plot area is not panned horizontally. If you set to 0.0, the plot area is not panned vertically.
An of 1.0 pans the plot area to the right so that the right edge of the plot area becomes the left edge of the plot area. An of 1.0 pans the plot area to the left so that the left edge of the plot area becomes the right edge of the plot area.
A of 1.0 pans the plot area to the top so that the top edge of the plot area becomes the bottom edge of the plot area. A of 1.0 pans the plot area to the bottom so that the bottom edge of the plot area becomes the top edge of the plot area.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.ComplexGraph.ZoomAroundPoint(System.Single,NationalInstruments.UI.ComplexPlot,NationalInstruments.ComplexDouble)
member.summary: Zooms around the specified data point with the specified zoom factor and reference plot.
member.param: The percentage to zoom by.
A to use as the context for .
The data point, represented as a , to zoom around.

exception.para: is less than or equal to 0.0.

member.remarks:
A value less than 1.0 indicates a zoom out, and a value greater than 1.0 indicates a zoom in. For example, a value of 0.8 zooms out by 80%, and a value of 1.5 zooms in by 150%. If is set to 1.0, the plot area is not zoomed because a value of 1.0 zooms by 100% of the view.
The imaginary and real parts of are mapped to client coordinates using the and properties of . The and act as the scale for mapping. The client coordinates are mapped to virtual coordinates using . The virtual coordinates are used to call .
Calling raises the event with set to .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.ComplexGraph.PlotLineColorGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that assigns different colors to plots.
member.value: The that assigns different colors to plots. The default value is .
member.remarks:
At design time, when you add, delete, or move a plot up and down, the colors are reassigned according to the order in which they are specified in the color set. At run time, the color of the plot depends on its index in the plot collection when you add the plot to the collection. If you delete a plot at run time, the color of the other plots does not change.
When this property changes, colors are assigned to all plots.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.ComplexGraph.UseColorGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets whether is enabled or disabled.
member.value: to enable ; otherwise, . The default value is .
member.remarks:
When this property is set to , plots are assigned different colors by the property; otherwise the plots default to , unless you have explicitly set the colors.
determines whether to draw the plot with auto-generated color or with a color you assign.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.DigitalWaveformGraph
member.summary: Represents the class for Measurement Studio Web Forms graphs that accept data.

remarks.para: A plots data. You can use the collection to include multiple instances on a single graph. With multiple plots, you can plot multiple sets of data in the same plot area. Use to plot a waveform and to plot an array of data. The controls the height of the digital plots. Use to specify the amount of space in pixels between signal plots and use to specify the distance in pixels between waveform plots.

You can enable or disable the mode of the scroll bar with and . Use to place the horizontal scroll bar at the top or bottom of the plot area. Use to place the vertical scroll bar to the left or right of the plot area. Use to customize the appearance of the scroll bar.
Use and to configure the digital x and y axes.
You can use to bind the graph to a data source.
remarks.note: For more information about the digital waveform graph control, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls or Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Digital Waveform Graph .NET Control Features.

member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls
Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Digital Waveform Graph .NET Control Features

member.summary: Plots a .

member.remarks:
does not copy the when it is plotted. Not copying the improves plotting performance, especially when dealing with large digital waveforms. The listens to changes on the and updates itself appropriately.
The deafult on the digital x-axis is . If you zoom or pan to an area and then plot new data, you might not see any data in the plot area. Consider calling or setting of the digital x-axis to view the data in the plot area.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.DigitalWaveformGraph.PlotWaveform(NationalInstruments.DigitalWaveform,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Plots a with the choice to copy the digital waveform.
member.param: The to plot.
Whether to copy the .
member.exception: The is set to and the plotted does not have timing information.

remarks.para: Setting to copies the when it is plotted. Copying the allows the plotted data to remain constant when changes are made to the . Copying large digital waveforms decreases plotting performance.

Setting to does not copy the when it is plotted. Not copying the improves plotting performance, especially when dealing with large digital waveforms. The listens to changes on the and updates itself appropriately.

is the base class for numeric pointer controls that display a numeric value in a radial scale.
supports interaction. Use to configure the interactions provided by the control. Use to snap the property to the mouse cursor.
Use to customize the color of the radial area containing the pointer. Specify the arc in which the scale is drawn with . Use to place divisions representing the minimum and maximum of the scale at different angles.
member.seealso: Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Pointer .NET Control Features

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.NumericPointer
member.summary: Provides an base class for all Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms controls that display a numeric value with a pointer and a scale.
member.remarks:
is the base class for all numeric pointer controls that display a numeric value with a pointer and a scale. Numeric pointer controls accept and display a numeric value, and they enable development of applications that represent scientific instruments with respect to appearance.
The numeric pointer controls have a single pointer and single scale. The pointer indicates the value of . Customize the appearance of the pointer through the property, and enhance the appearance of the control by setting to .
The scale related properties are exposed by to facilitate their access. determines the minimum and maximum values of the scale. Use the property to automatically calculate the location of tick marks. Customize the appearance of tick marks and labels with the and properties. You can also change the format of the labels through these properties. Use to place a division at any value with customized text for the label. Change the scale to logarithmic by changing and setting .
Use the property to change by discrete intervals or continuously within .
The control raises the event before is changed and event after has changed. Cancel the event to prevent from changing. The property of the event argument is set based on how the change was affected.
Use and to move the pointer to the previous and next values programmatically.
For more information about the numeric pointer control, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Pointer .NET Controls or Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Pointer .NET Control Features.
member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Pointer .NET Controls
Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Pointer .NET Control Features

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.NumericEdit
member.summary: Represents a Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms numeric edit control to display and edit numeric values.

remarks.para: A numeric edit control stores and displays a double value. You can change the of the control using a text box.
Use the property to change how the user interacts with the control. Set to to disable user interaction. Set to a value that includes to allow user interaction through text entry.

determines the format of the displayed value when viewing and editing the value of the control. provides a number of static methods that you can use to choose a common formatting mode. You can also create custom format modes for the numeric edit control by inheriting .
defines the range of valid values for the control. You can set the property to allow either continuous or discrete values.

The numeric edit control raises the event before the property changes and raises the event after the property changes. You can cancel the event to prevent the property from changing. The property of the event argument is set based on how the change was affected.
remarks.note: For more information about the numeric edit control, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Edit .NET Control or Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Edit .NET Control Features.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.NumericEdit.FormatMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode used to format the value of the control.
member.value: A that is used to format the value of the control. The default value is a that formats the value as a double.

remarks.para: You can set the property to any instance of , including the format modes that the static methods return and any custom class that implements the base class.
The following format modes are available through the class:

item.description: Displays the value in a simple double format with a specified precision. Use the method to create an instance of a simple double format mode.
Displays the value using Standard Numeric Format Strings. Use the method to create an instance of a generic format mode.
Displays the value using format strings. Use the method to create an instance of an engineering format mode.
Displays the value in hexadecimal format. Use the method to create an instance of a hexadecimal format mode.
Displays the value in binary format. Use the method to create an instance of a binary format mode.
Displays the value using scientific notation format. Use the method to create an instance of a scientific format mode.

remarks.para: For more information, refer to the class.

The numeric edit control does not apply the formatting specified by until the control loses focus. For formatting modes such as generic and engineering, the value displayed for editing differs from the formatted value, so the user does not see the formatted value until the control loses focus.

member.seealso: Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Numeric Edit .NET Control Features

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.ScatterGraph
member.summary: Represents the class for Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms graphs that accept both x and y data values.
member.remarks:
The ability to specify x and y data values allows you to plot non-monotonically increasing data. You can determine whether plot colors are assigned by a color generator with the property, and you can change the plot color assignment with the property.
You can use the collection to include multiple instances on a single graph. With multiple plots, you can plot multiple sets of data in the same plot area.
Use to plot a single y value against a single x value or an array of y values against an array of x values. plots y values against x values by appending the x and y values to the existing data.
You can plot multiple sets of y data values against a single set of x data values with a single method invocation. Use to plot a 2D array of y values against an array of x values. behaves in much the same way, except that it appends the data to the existing data for plotting. plots a 2D array of x values against an array of y values. behaves similarly but appends the data to the existing data.
For more information about the scatter graph control, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls or Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Scatter and Waveform Graph .NET Control Features.
member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls
Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Scatter and Waveform Graph .NET Control Features

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.XYGraph
member.summary: Provides an base class for Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms graphs that plot data on a set of x and y axes.

remarks.para: accepts data as a .

and collections allow multiple x and y axes to coexist on a single graph. You can use multiple axes to plot multiple sets of data that are scaled differently from each other. The event occurs when the collection is modified through an add, remove, insert, or clear operation. The event occurs when the collection is similarly modified.

raises when the on an , contained in its collection, changes. Similarly, occurs when the
on a , contained in its collection, changes.

Custom drawn plots are supported through the and events. occurs before the plot is drawn. occurs after the plot is drawn. Use these events to participate in the drawing of a plot that is contained in the plot collection. occurs when a new set of data is plotted.

Plot area cursors are supported. You can use cursors to annotate plots and the plot area. accepts multiple cursors through the collection. The event occurs when the collection is modified through an add, remove, insert, or clear operation.
remarks.note: For more information about the XY graph control, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls.

member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.XYGraph.ZoomAroundPoint(System.Single,NationalInstruments.UI.XYPlot,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Zooms around the specified data point with the specified zoom factor and reference plot.
member.param: The percentage to zoom by.
An to use as the context for and .
The x data value to zoom around.
The y data value to zoom around.

exception.para: The is less than or equal to 0.0.

member.remarks:
A value less than 1.0 indicates a zoom out, and a value greater than 1.0 indicates a zoom in. For example, a value of 0.8 zooms out by 80%, and a value of 1.5 zooms in by 150%. If is set to 1.0, the plot area is not zoomed because a value of 1.0 zooms by 100% of the view.
The and values are mapped to client coordinates using the and properties, respectively, of . and act as the scale for mapping. The client coordinates are mapped to virtual coordinates using . The virtual coordinates are used to call .
Calling raises the event with set to .
Refer to for information about zooming interactively.
member.seealso: Converting Data Types Using Measurement Studio DataConverter

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.ScatterGraph.PlotLineColorGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that assigns different colors to plots.
member.value: The that assigns different colors to plots. The default value is .
member.remarks:
At design time, when you add, delete, or move a plot up and down, the colors are reassigned according to the order in which they are specified in the color set. At run time, the color of the plot depends on its index in the plot collection when you add the plot to the collection. If you delete a plot at run time, the color of the other plots does not change.
When this property changes, colors are assigned to all plots.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.ScatterGraph.UseColorGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets whether is enabled or disabled.
member.value: to enable ; otherwise, . The default value is .
member.remarks:
When this property is set to , plots are assigned different colors by the property; otherwise the plots default to , unless you have explicitly set the colors.
determines whether to draw the plot with auto-generated color or with a color you assign.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.WaveformGraph
member.summary: Represents the class for Measurement Studio ASP.NET Web Forms graphs that accept data as a waveform.

remarks.para: A waveform is defined as a set of data against equally spaced increments.

You can use the collection to include multiple instances on a single graph. With multiple plots, you can plot multiple sets of data in the same plot area. You can determine whether plot colors are assigned by a color generator with the property, and you can change the plot color assignment with the property.

Use to plot a single x value or an array of x values against a starting y value.
uses the specified value to increment y values or a default value if one is not specified. plots x values by appending the values to the existing data.

You can plot multiple sets of x data values with a single method invocation. Use to plot a 2D array of x values against a starting y value. uses the specified value to increment y values or a default value if one is not specified. behaves in much the same way, except that it appends the data to the existing data for plotting.

Use to plot a single y value or an array of y values against a starting x value. uses the specified value to increment x values or a default value if one is not specified. plots y values by appending the values to the existing data.

You can plot multiple sets of y data values with a single method invocation. Use to plot a 2D array of y values against a starting x value. uses a specified value to increment x values or a default value if one is not specified. behaves in much the same way, except that it appends the data to the existing data for plotting.

para.filter: You can use to plot or data and to append the waveform to the existing data.
You can use to plot data and to append the waveform to the existing data.
Use to plot a 1D array of or data or use to append an array to the existing data. Similarly, you can use to plot a 2D array of or data and to append the waveforms against the existing data.
Use to plot a 1D array of data or use to append an array to the existing data. Similarly, you can use to plot a 2D array of data and to append the waveforms against the existing data.

remarks.para: You can use to plot data against the waveform sample units and to append the waveform to the existing data.

Use to plot a 1D array of data against the waveform sample units or use to append an array to the existing data. Similarly, you can use to plot a 2D array of data against the waveform sample units and to append the waveforms against the existing data.
Use to bind the graph to a data source. The method to invoke when bound to a data source is specified by the value of .
remarks.note: For more information about the waveform graph control, refer to Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls or Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Scatter and Waveform Graph .NET Control Features.

member.seealso: Using the Measurement Studio Web Forms Graph .NET Controls
Key Measurement Studio Web Forms Scatter and Waveform Graph .NET Control Features

member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
member.remarks:
This method is called by the public method and the finalizer. invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the parameter set to . The finalizer invokes with set to .
When the parameter is , this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. This method invokes the of each referenced object.
can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding Dispose(Boolean), be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.WaveformGraph.PlotXAppendMultiple(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Plots a 2D array of x values with the default data orientation against a starting y value by appending the x and y values to the existing data.
member.param: The 2D array of x values to plot.

remarks.para: The orientation of data in is specified by .

This method calls on instances in using the index of rows or columns of based on the value of . The value of the plot is used as the starting y value if there is no existing data; otherwise, the starting y value is determined by adding the value of the plot to the last y value in the existing data. The value of the plot is used for incrementing y values.

If there are not enough plots available in , additional instances are created and added to the collection as required. The implicitly created instances are associated with the first and first in and , respectively. If or are empty, an additional or is created and added to the collection.

To prevent an exception from being thrown, call on the plot after calling , , , , , or , but before calling . Refer to on the plot to determine the category of the method that is currently being used to plot data.

To successfully change the increment from a previously negative value to a positive value or from a previously positive value to a negative value, call on the plot before changing the value. Refer to of the plot to determine the polarity of the currently used increment.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates plotting an array of x values represented as a 1D double array. The code can be used to plot a single data point across multiple plots. The example assumes that a called waveformGraph1 has been declared and initialized.
Dim xValues As Double() = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10} Dim xValuesMatrix As Double(,) = CType(NationalInstruments.DataConverter.Convert(xValues, GetType(Double(,))), Double(,)) waveformGraph1.DefaultDataOrientation = DataOrientation.DataInColumns waveformGraph1.PlotXAppendMultiple(xValuesMatrix)

Dim yValues As Double() = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10} Dim yValuesMatrix As Double(,) = CType(NationalInstruments.DataConverter.Convert(yValues, GetType(Double(,))), Double(,)) waveformGraph1.PlotYMultiple(yValuesMatrix, DataOrientation.DataInColumns, DateTime.Now, TimeSpan.FromSeconds(1), PlotDateTimePrecisionMode.Precise)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.WaveformGraph.PlotYAppend(System.Double)
member.summary: Plots a single y value against a starting x value by appending the x and y value to the existing data.
member.param: The y value to append.

remarks.para: This method calls on the first in . The value of the plot is used as the starting x value if there is no existing data; otherwise, the starting x value is determined by adding the value of the plot to the last x value in the existing data.

If there are not enough plots available in , additional instances are created and added to the collection as required. The implicitly created instances are associated with the first and first in and , respectively. If or are empty, an additional or is created and added to the collection.

To prevent an exception from being thrown, call on the plot after calling , , , , , or , but before calling . Refer to on the plot to determine the category of the method that is currently being used to plot data.

To successfully change the increment from a previously negative value to a positive value or from a previously positive value to a negative value, call on the plot before changing the value. Refer to of the plot to determine the polarity of the currently used increment.
To call on another plot in the collection, use the indexer provided by to obtain a reference to the plot, and then call on the plot reference.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.WaveformGraph.PlotLineColorGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets the that assigns different colors to plots.
member.value: The that assigns different colors to plots. The default value is .
member.remarks:
At design time, when you add, delete, or move a plot up and down, the colors are reassigned according to the order in which they are specified in the color set. At run time, the color of the plot depends on its index in the plot collection when you add the plot to the collection. If you delete a plot at run time, the color of the other plots does not change.
When this property changes, colors are assigned to all plots.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.UI.WebForms.WaveformGraph.UseColorGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets whether is enabled or disabled.
member.value: to enable ; otherwise, . The default value is .
member.remarks:
When this property is set to , plots are assigned different colors by the property; otherwise the plots default to , unless you have explicitly set the colors.
determines whether to draw the plot with auto-generated color or with a color you assign.
